Module lib/inversion

Index

Type aliases

  • InversionModel
  • InversionResult

Type aliases

InversionModel

InversionModel: { alpha: AlphaParameters; data: Data[]; onMessage?: Function; onProgress?: Function }
brief

Parameters for the inversion, which are the measured and the calculated data along with their associated cost function and weight. The AlphaParameters has to be provided as well with the number of iterations for the inversion algorithm.

Type declaration

  • alpha: AlphaParameters

    The parameter space to use with the mapping if necessary

  • data: Data[]

    All the provided Data to constrain the inversion

  • Optional onMessage?: Function

    The messages callback

  • Optional onProgress?: Function

    The progression callback for the method of inversion (monte-carlo, mcmc, Bees, ...)

InversionResult

InversionResult: { alpha: number[]; cost: number; fit: number; iteration: number; maxIteration: number; user: number[] }
brief

The inversion solution

Type declaration

  • alpha: number[]

    The inverted Alpha parameters

  • cost: number

    The best cost from inversion in [0, 1]. A value close to zero means a "good" inversion. A value close to one means the opposite.

  • fit: number

    The best fit in %. The fit is related to cost by: fit = 100(1-cost)

  • iteration: number

    The iteration where the min was detected

  • maxIteration: number

    The max number of iterations

  • user: number[]

    The corresponding inverted user parameters (inverse mapping). If the mapping was not provided, then user will be equal to alpha
